name: Product Roadmap Template
description: Create a time-based product roadmap with themes, milestones, and dependency mapping
example_output:
# Product Roadmap: AI PM Workspace

## Roadmap Overview
- **Product**: AI-powered Product Management Workspace
- **Time Horizon**: H1 2026 (January - June)
- **Roadmap Owner**: Head of Product
- **Last Updated**: January 15, 2026
- **Roadmap Type**: Outcome-based with time horizons
- **Planning Cadence**: Quarterly refresh, monthly check-in

---

## Strategic Context

### Vision
Become the default workspace where product managers think, decide, and communicate, powered by AI that understands their product context.

### Strategic Pillars
1. **AI-First Productivity**: Make every PM artifact 10x faster to create
2. **Context Intelligence**: Build the deepest understanding of each user's product
3. **Team Collaboration**: Enable seamless sharing and alignment across product teams
4. **Platform Extensibility**: Allow integrations with existing PM tool ecosystems

---

## Now: January - February 2026
*Theme: Foundation & Core Value*

### Milestone: Public Beta Launch (Feb 15)
Confidence: High (90%)

| Initiative | Description | Status | Owner | Dependencies |
|---|---|---|---|---|
| Context-aware generation | AI generates frameworks using uploaded product documents | In Progress | AI Team | Document parser (complete) |
| Framework library v1 | 30+ frameworks across 6 categories (strategy, discovery, execution, etc.) | In Progress | Content Team | Template schema (complete) |
| User authentication & projects | Auth flow, project creation, document management | Complete | Platform Team | None |
| Export & sharing | Export to Markdown, PDF; shareable links | In Progress | Product Team | Auth (complete) |
| Onboarding flow | Guided first-run experience with sample project | Not Started | Growth Team | Framework library v1 |

### Key Results for This Period
- 500 beta signups with 200+ activated users
- Framework output quality score >= 4.0/5.0
- Time to first framework < 5 minutes for new users

---

## Next: March - April 2026
*Theme: Engagement & Retention*

### Milestone: Retention Baseline Established (Apr 30)
Confidence: Medium (70%)

| Initiative | Description | Status | Owner | Dependencies |
|---|---|---|---|---|
| Framework history & versioning | Track changes, compare versions, restore previous outputs | Planning | Product Team | Export & sharing |
| AI quality improvements v2 | Fine-tuned prompts based on beta feedback; style customization | Planning | AI Team | Beta user feedback (Q1) |
| Team workspaces | Shared projects, team libraries, role-based access | Planning | Platform Team | Auth improvements |
| Integrations v1: Jira & Linear | Import tickets and epics as context for framework generation | Discovery | Platform Team | Context engine |
| Analytics dashboard for users | Show users their productivity metrics and usage patterns | Not Started | Product Team | Usage tracking |

### Key Results for This Period
- Day 30 retention >= 30% (from current 18%)
- 3+ frameworks generated per active user per week
- Team workspace adoption: 25% of users in a shared workspace

---

## Later: May - June 2026
*Theme: Growth & Monetization*

### Milestone: Paid Plan Launch (Jun 1)
Confidence: Low (50%)

| Initiative | Description | Status | Owner | Dependencies |
|---|---|---|---|---|
| Premium tier & billing | Stripe integration, plan management, usage limits | Discovery | Platform Team | Team workspaces |
| Advanced AI features | Custom trained models per workspace, tone/style presets | Discovery | AI Team | AI quality v2 |
| Integrations v2: Notion, Confluence | Bi-directional sync with popular documentation tools | Discovery | Platform Team | Integrations v1 |
| Template marketplace | Community-contributed framework templates with ratings | Ideation | Content Team | Framework library v1 |
| Enterprise features | SSO, audit logs, admin controls, dedicated support | Ideation | Platform Team | Team workspaces |

### Key Results for This Period
- Free-to-paid conversion rate >= 5%
- MRR reaches $50,000
- 50+ community-contributed templates in marketplace

---

## Dependency Map

Critical path and cross-team dependencies:

| Dependency | Upstream | Downstream | Risk Level | Mitigation |
|---|---|---|---|---|
| Document parser | AI Team (Complete) | Context-aware generation | Low | Already delivered |
| Beta user feedback | Growth Team (Q1) | AI quality v2 | Medium | Start collecting feedback Week 1 of beta |
| Auth improvements | Platform Team (Feb) | Team workspaces | Medium | Can start workspace UI work in parallel |
| Context engine | AI Team (Feb) | Integrations v1 | High | Context engine is critical path; prioritize |
| Team workspaces | Platform Team (Apr) | Premium tier, Enterprise | High | Billing can be built independently |

---

## Risks & Mitigations

| Risk | Probability | Impact | Mitigation |
|---|---|---|---|
| AI output quality doesn't reach 4.0/5.0 target | Medium | High | Invest in prompt engineering; add human review option |
| Beta adoption slower than projected | Medium | Medium | Increase outreach; partner with PM influencers |
| Integration complexity with Jira/Linear APIs | Medium | Medium | Start with read-only; expand to write later |
| LLM costs exceed unit economics targets | Low | High | Implement caching; use smaller models for drafts |
| Team workspaces scope expands beyond estimate | High | Medium | Define strict MVP; defer admin features to Later |

---

## Resource Allocation

| Team | Now (Jan-Feb) | Next (Mar-Apr) | Later (May-Jun) |
|---|---|---|---|
| AI Team (3 engineers) | Context generation (80%), Quality baseline (20%) | Quality v2 (60%), Integrations support (40%) | Advanced AI (70%), Maintenance (30%) |
| Platform Team (4 engineers) | Auth & projects (40%), Export (30%), Infra (30%) | Team workspaces (60%), Integrations v1 (40%) | Billing (40%), Enterprise (30%), Integrations v2 (30%) |
| Growth Team (2) | Onboarding (60%), Beta recruitment (40%) | Retention experiments (70%), Analytics (30%) | Conversion optimization (80%), Marketplace (20%) |
| Content Team (1) | Framework library (100%) | Style customization (50%), Documentation (50%) | Template marketplace (70%), Documentation (30%) |

---

## Review & Update Cadence
- **Weekly**: Team leads review initiative status and flag blockers
- **Monthly**: Product leadership reviews roadmap progress against key results
- **Quarterly**: Full roadmap refresh with updated priorities and new Later items
- **Ad hoc**: Major pivots triggered by significant user feedback or market changes
system_prompt:
You are a product strategy and planning expert specializing in creating clear, actionable product roadmaps that align teams around outcomes.

Your task is to help the user create a structured product roadmap that communicates what the team is building, why, and when, while maintaining flexibility for changing priorities.

## Methodology:

Use a Now/Next/Later time horizon framework combined with outcome-based planning:

1. **Roadmap Overview**: Establish the product, time horizon, owner, planning cadence, and roadmap type (outcome-based, feature-based, or hybrid).

2. **Strategic Context**: Define the product vision (one sentence) and 3-4 strategic pillars that guide all roadmap decisions. Every initiative on the roadmap should map back to a pillar.

3. **Now (Current Quarter/Cycle)**: High-confidence, committed work. Include:
   - A clear theme for the period
   - A concrete milestone with target date and confidence level
   - Initiative table with description, status, owner, and dependencies
   - 2-3 measurable key results for the period

4. **Next (Following Quarter/Cycle)**: Medium-confidence, planned work. Same structure as Now but with more flexibility noted. Confidence levels should be lower.

5. **Later (2+ Quarters Out)**: Low-confidence, exploratory work. Include initiative ideas with less detail. These are directional, not committed.

6. **Dependency Map**: Create a table showing cross-team and cross-initiative dependencies. Flag risk levels and mitigations for each.

7. **Risks & Mitigations**: Identify 4-6 risks to the roadmap with probability, impact, and mitigation strategies.

8. **Resource Allocation**: Show how team capacity is distributed across initiatives for each time period.

9. **Review Cadence**: Define how often the roadmap is reviewed, by whom, and what triggers an ad-hoc update.

## Best Practices:
- Lead with outcomes, not features. Frame initiatives in terms of what they achieve for users.
- Use confidence levels (High/Medium/Low or percentages) to communicate certainty. Now should be high confidence; Later should be low.
- Every initiative needs an owner. Unowned work will not get done.
- Dependencies are the number one roadmap risk. Map them explicitly.
- Keep Later items intentionally vague; premature specificity creates false commitments.
- Include resource allocation so the roadmap is realistic, not aspirational.
- Use the Now/Next/Later framework instead of exact dates for anything beyond the current cycle to avoid false precision.
- A roadmap is a communication tool, not a project plan. Optimize for clarity and alignment.
- Use markdown tables for initiative tracking and clean formatting throughout.
guiding_questions: What is your product and what is its core value proposition?
What are your 3-4 strategic pillars or focus areas for the coming period?
What is your planning time horizon (quarters, half-year, full year)?
What major milestones or launches are you targeting and when?
What teams or functions contribute to the roadmap and what is their capacity?
What are the biggest dependencies or risks you are aware of?
What key results or outcomes do you need to achieve in each time period?
